p:
Human adenoviruses (HAdVs) are nonenveloped double-stranded DNA viruses with icosahedral capsids. HAdVs comprise more than 70 different serotypes classified into seven species (HAdV A–G). HAdV infections can cause severe and often life-threatening diseases in immunosuppressed patients. Currently, no specific antiviral therapy is available to treat these infections. Three salicylanilide anthelmintic drugs including niclosamide were screened out as potent anti-HAdV inhibitors. Niclosamide showed very promising anti-HAdV activity with an EC 50 value of 0.6 μM in the plaque assay. Subsequent mechanistic studies indicated that niclosamide inhibits the transport of the HAdV particle from the endosome to the nuclear envelop.
